Text
portsIn.value: When set, the master key is disabled and cannot be used to sign transactions.

Text
portsIn.value: When this flag is set, the account cannot be the destination for checkCreate transactions.

portsIn.name: JavaScript

Text
portsIn.value: When set, the account cannot be the destination for any incoming NFToken (Non-Fungible Token) offer transactions.

portsIn.name: JavaScript

Text
portsIn.value: When set, the account cannot be the destination for any incoming PaymentChannel transactions.

Text
portsIn.value: When this flag is set, the account cannot be the destination for any trust lines (also known as credit lines).

portsIn.value: When enabled, the account has frozen all trust lines it owns.

portsIn.value: If set, the account cannot freeze trust lines.

Text

Text
portsIn.value: If enabled, this flag mandates that all incoming payments to the account must include a destination tag.

portsIn.name: Text
portsIn.value:
Require Destination Tags:
Enable if you process withdrawals of your token to outside systems.

portsIn.name: Text
portsIn.value:
Disallow XRP:
Enable if this address isn't meant to process XRP payments.

portsIn.name: Text
portsIn.value:
Tranfer Fee:
Charge a percentage fee when users send your token to each other. (Recommended Value: 0-1%)

portsIn.name: Text
portsIn.value:
Tick Size:
Limit the number of decimal places in exchange rates for your token in the decentralized exchange. A tick size of 5-6 reduces churn of almost-equivalent offers and speeds up price discovery compared to the default of 15. (Recommended Value: 5)

portsIn.name: Text
portsIn.value:
Domain:
Set to a domain you own so can verify ownership of the accounts. This can help reduce confusion or impersonation attempts.

portsIn.name: Text
portsIn.value:
Default Ripple:
This setting is required so that users can send your token to each other. It's best to enable it before setting up any trust lines or issuing any tokens.

portsIn.name: Style
Text
portsIn.value:
Authorized Trust Lines:
This setting (also called "Require Auth") limits your tokens to being held only by accounts you've explicitly approved. You cannot enable this setting if you already have any trust lines or offers for any token.
